channel.title: Technology providers on EDRLab members
channel.description: Recent content in Technology providers on EDRLab members

item.title: Art Book Magazine
item.description: the company behind LISA Reader, one of the first reading apps having supported the LCP DRM.

item.title: Bibliopresto
item.description: A non-profit organization in Quebec that supports libraries by offering them digital tools and services

item.title: Bluefire
item.description: the company which is behind Bluefire Reader, a well-known EPUB reader in the USA. Note that for now, Bluefire Reader does not rely on the Readium toolkits and does not support the LCP DRM.

item.title: Dilicom
item.description: the hub by which book orders flow through in France; Dilicom also manages the B2B exchanges related to the national ebook lending solution Prêt Numérique en Bibliothèque.

item.title: ePagine
item.description: a French e-bookstore (epagine.fr) that also operates www.placedeslibraires.fr, an e-bookstore shared by multiple independent booksellers.

item.title: Fênix Tecnologias Educacionais
item.description: an education technology and services company.

item.title: Firebrand Technologies
item.description: helps publishers and authors promote digital review copies to book advocates and industry professionals. Operates [NetGalley](https://www.netgalley.com/)

item.title: Firsty Group
item.description: a company that distributes a large volume of EPUB in the UK and develops white-labeled Readium-based reading applications for multiple publishers.

item.title: Icontact BV
item.description: the developer of a watermark solution for EPUB.

item.title: inkBOOK
item.description: a developer of e-ink Readers and Readium-based mobile applications that support the LCP DRM.

item.title: ISI
item.description: a company developing backend tools for creating accessible fixed-layout EPUBs (mainly textbooks) from PDF files.

item.title: Mantano
item.description: the company behind the Bookari mobile reading application.

item.title: Nord Compo
item.description: a company offering multiple publishing services, with a large EPUB expertise. Nord Compo can develop custom Readium-based mobile reading applications, with LCP support.

item.title: Notion Wave
item.description: its flagship product, KNiTO is a complete EPUB 3 authoring, publishing, sales, and reader solution. KNiTO Store is a dedicated EPUB 3 book shop.

item.title: Rede Nacional de Ensino e Pesquisa (RNP)
item.description: Rede Nacional de Ensino e Pesquisa is a non-profit organization which operates and develops the national advanced networking infrastructure, known as the Ipê network, for cooperation and communication in education, research, health and culture. RNP is also operating the deployment of the LCP DRM for the Brazilian PNLD program, which will soon provide ebooks to millions of students in Brazil.

item.title: Vivlio
item.description: an ebook and audiobook distributor and developer of technical solutions for ebook distribution, including e-readers, desktop and mobile applications.

item.title: Web 2 Market
item.description: provides e-commerce solutions for small and medium-sized publishers, primarily using the Magento and Shopify platforms, making it easy and affordable to sell online.
